Paragraph: One patient in the Gamma Knife group ( 3 . 4 % ) developed a homonymous hemianopsia 9 months following treatment and 5 patients ( 27 . 7 % ) in the radiofrequency group became transiently confused postoperatively .

In the given paragraph, the two diseases mentioned are "homonymous hemianopsia" and "confusion". The former is described as a condition that affected one patient in the Gamma Knife group nine months after treatment, while the latter was a temporary condition experienced by five patients in the radiofrequency group postoperatively.

In this case, since the paragraph does not provide enough context to determine if the confusion mentioned is a symptom of a specific disease or a standalone condition, it is not included in the table. However, homonymous hemianopsia is clearly identified as a disease that affected one patient in the Gamma Knife group.
